header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/whitespace.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines macros used to remove whitespace from an argument.

macro.abstract: The macro removes leading whitespace from its argument.

usage.param: The argument whose leading whitespace is to be removed.

macro.para: This macro removes leading whitespace (if any) from its argument by concatenating a placemarker to the first preprocessing token of __VA_ARGS__.
This macro is only useful for subsequent production of string literals (via the stringizing operator) or header-name preprocessing tokens of the h-char-sequence form.

macro.abstract: The macro removes trailing whitespace from its argument.

usage.param: The argument whose trailing whitespace is to be removed.

macro.para: This macro removes trailing whitespace (if any) from its argument by concatenating a placemarker to the last preprocessing token of __VA_ARGS__.
This macro is only useful for subsequent production of string literals (via the stringizing operator) or header-name preprocessing tokens of the h-char-sequence form.

macro.abstract: The macro removes leading and trailing whitespace from its argument.

usage.param: The argument whose leading and trailing whitespace is to be removed.

macro.para: This macro removes both leading and trailing whitespace (if any) from its argument by concatenating a placemarker to both the first and the last preprocessing token of __VA_ARGS__.
This macro is only useful for subsequent production of string literals (via the stringizing operator) or header-name preprocessing tokens of the h-char-sequence form.
